back.text:
Root: ز ل ز ل (Z-L-Z-L)
Meaning: Is shaken
Pronunciation: Zulzilat
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. زَلْزَال (Zilzāl): An earthquake
2. زَلْزَلَة (Zalzalah): Tremor, violent shaking
Example Ayah: إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا

hint.text: The first word of the Surah's event.

back.text:
Root: أ ر ض (A-R-Ḍ)
Meaning: The earth
Pronunciation: Al-Arḍu
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Isti'lā** on the 'ض'.
Derived Words:
1. أَرْض (Arḍ): Earth, land
2. أَرَاضٍ (Arāḍī): Lands
Example Ayah: وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَدَّ الْأَرْضَ

hint.text: The planet that will shake violently.

back.text:
Root: ز ل ز ل (Z-L-Z-L)
Meaning: Its earthquake
Pronunciation: Zilzālahā
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'زَا'.
Derived Words:
1. زَلْزَلَة (Zalzalah): A mighty quake
Example Ayah: إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا

hint.text: The specific final earthquake of the earth.

back.text:
Root: ث ق ل (Th-Q-L)
Meaning: Its burdens
Pronunciation: Athqālahā
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'قَا'.
Derived Words:
1. ثَقِيل (Thaqīl): Heavy
2. ثِقْل (Thiql): Weight, burden
Example Ayah: وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا

hint.text: What the earth will discharge (buried people or treasures).

back.text:
Root: خ ب ر (Kh-B-R)
Meaning: Its news
Pronunciation: Akhbārahā
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'بَا'.
Derived Words:
1. خَبَر (Khabar): News, information
2. مُخْبِر (Mukbir): Informer
Example Ayah: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا

hint.text: The earth will testify about human deeds.

back.text:
Root: ش ت ت (Sh-T-T)
Meaning: In scattered groups
Pronunciation: Ashtātan
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'تَا'.
Derived Words:
1. شَتَّ (Shatta): To scatter
2. شَتَات (Shatāt): Dispersion
Example Ayah: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا

hint.text: People will come forth separated for judgment.

back.text:
Root: ث ق ل (Th-Q-L)
Meaning: Weight of (even a tiny amount)
Pronunciation: Mithqāla
Tajweed Rules: **Ikhfā'** of the 'ث' when followed by 'ق'.
Derived Words:
1. ثِقْل (Thiql): Weight
2. ثَقِيل (Thaqīl): Heavy
Example Ayah: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ

Root: ذ ر ر (Dh-R-R)
Meaning: An atom, tiny particle
Pronunciation: Dharrah
Tajweed Rules: Clear 'ذ' and rolled 'ر'.
Derived Words:
1. ذَرّ (Dharr): Minute particles
2. ذُرِّيَّة (Dhurrīyah): Offspring (from the idea of tiny seeds)
Example Ayah: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ

hint.text: The smallest unit of measure for deeds.
